PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8302651463/job/22725365572)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8302651463/job/22725365099)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8302651463/job/22725365267)
I don't understand this change, what is going on?
I want a way to test that `apply?` finds `minFac_prime` (fast). This is my best approximation of testing that. Ideally we should test that it appears amongst the first 10 suggestions.
Could you explain *how* it tests that? I still find this completely inscrutable. :-)

Well, `observe : p.Prime` has to find a proof, and I'm assuming it finds `minFac_prime`.

But I would much rather do something like
```lean
have hp : p.Prime := by
  -- the next two lines are pseudocode, I hope you get the idea
  let suggestions := by apply?
  assert `minFac_prime \in suggestions.take 10
  apply minFac_prime -- actually apply the lemma that we want
  observe : n.factorial > 0
  linarith
```
Can you just wrap `observe` or `apply?` with a `show_term`? You could even wrap that with a `#guard_msgs` (maybe we have a tactic version?).
Aha, I guess we would need a tactic version of `guard_msgs`... but I wouldn't know how to make this precise.
I *still* do not understand why you care about this. I would much rather this file contains a nice easy proof than an inscrutable test.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - perf(test/observe): set low maxHeartbeats for test
